item.source: I can compile but i cant run?

item.title: I can compile but i cant run?
item.dc:creator: @Sephiroth1 Sephiroth~
item.description:
@Sephiroth1 wrote:

you use your head…

this is where I have installed java JDK, in
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\

this is where I have installed my java JRE in:
C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_09\

Now, my JDK (java development kit) version is 1.5.0_07, yours might be 1.5.0_09 or whatever, look for yourself, remember, it is java --> JDK <-- NOT JRE!!! Heaps of people make this mistake!

When you found the path, place

bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java at the end of it, then copy the entire line and paste it into the bat file (the file with a gearwheel icon)
that will set your compiler

now, all together, the line should look at bit like this:

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java

depending on your java JDK version - NOTE: INCLUDE QUOTATION MARKS these things “”

Now, your compiler is set:

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java

now, to get server running:
Go back to where you found your java JDK, and this time look for java JRE <-- JRE THIS TIME! (Java runtime environment)

When you found it, place

bin/java.exe" server at the end of it, so altogether, it should look like this:
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_09\bin/java.exe” server
depending on your java JRE version, mine is 1.5.0_09, yours may be different

now, paste that line into the compiler, altogether, it should look like this:

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_09\bin/java.exe" server pause

the @echo off is optional

the pause is also optional, but i like to put it there for some reason

save it, double click on the batch file and the server should compile, then run

Read full topic

item.source: I can compile but i cant run?

item.title: I can compile but i cant run?
item.dc:creator: @Sephiroth1 Sephiroth~
item.description:
@Sephiroth1 wrote:

hm… replace the compiler’s contents with this:

@echo off title SERVER "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_09\bin/java.exe" server pause

Where it says C:\Program Files etc. place that with the path where your java folder is located

This is my compiling path, the verisons of java may be different as well

Read full topic

item.title: I can compile but i cant run?
item.dc:creator: @Leon101 Leon101
item.description:
@Leon101 wrote:

[glow=red,2,300]
Souce-Pimpscape
What It Says-It Says "Java"is not reconized as an inxteral or external command press any key to continue…

What I Have In Compiler=Below!

@echo off
cls
:menu
title ScapeRune Compiler By Lupe182
echo Please choose an option below to do that function.
echo Keep posted on the Moparscape Tutorials section for
echo any updates that I post.
echo.
echo c - Compile your server.
echo r - To run your server.
echo e - To exit out of the program.
echo.
echo.
set /p compile=Option:
if %compile%==c goto compile
if %compile%==C goto compile
if %compile%==r goto run
if %compile%==R goto run
if %compile%==e goto end
if %compile%==E goto end
if %compile#==* goto error
goto error
:compile
cls
title Compiler
if defined javac (goto compile2) else (goto checkjavac)
:compile2
if exist *.java (goto compile3) else (goto compileerror)
:compile3
%javac% -cp . *.java
pause
cls
goto menu
:compileerror
cls
echo You need to have Java files for this compiler to compile.
pause
cls
goto menu
:run
cls
title Runserver
if exist .\server.class (goto run2) else (goto servererror)
:run2
set java=java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar
cls
goto run3
:run3
%java% server
pause
cls
goto menu
:servererror
cls
title Error
echo You do not have a Server.class. Make sure that you have used the
echo compiler with your server BEFORE you try running it.
pause
cls
goto menu
:error
cls
title Error
echo Invalid command. Please make sure the commands you type
echo in are correct.
pause
cls
goto menu
:end
cls
exit
:checkjavac
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac) else (goto checkjavac2)
:checkjavac2
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac2) else (goto checkjavac3)
:checkjavac3
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_08\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac3) else (goto checkjavac4)
:checkjavac4
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac4) else (goto checkjavac5)
:checkjavac5
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_10\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac5) else (goto checkjavac6)
:checkjavac6
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe” (goto setjavac6) else (goto javacerror)
:setjavac
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac2
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\javac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac3
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_08\bin\javac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac4
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac5
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.5.0_10\bin\javac.exe"
goto compile2
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe"
goto compile2
:javacerror
cls
title Error
echo You do not have JDK 5.0 Update 6-10 or JDK 6.0. Go to Mod Taharok’s tutorial
echo on the Moparscape Tuturoials section for a direct link to download
echo the newest JDK Update.
pause
cls
goto menu[/glow]
